gw.cc.claim.entity

Interface Claim

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AnswerContainer, AnswerSetContainer, ClaimContactRoleOwner, com.guidewire.cc.domain.contact.EntityContactRoleOwner, com.guidewire.cc.domain.purging.Purgeable, UserRoleOwner

    public interface Claim
extends UserRoleOwner, ClaimContactRoleOwner, AnswerSetContainer, com.guidewire.cc.domain.purging.Purgeable
    Claim Insurance claim

    • Method Detail

      • createSubrogationSummaryIdempotently

        SubrogationSummary createSubrogationSummaryIdempotently()
        Add a new Subrogation summary to claim if one doesn't exist, otherwise return the existing one.

        subrogation summary (new or existing) related to this claim.

      • refreshPolicy

        void refreshPolicy()
            throws com.guidewire.cc.domain.policy.impl.PolicyNotFoundException,
                   com.guidewire.cc.domain.policy.impl.PolicyNotUniqueException
        Reload the claim's policy from the Policy adapter and refresh any claim-related information. Retrieves policy using the current policy number and claim loss date and sets it on the claim again.
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.cc.domain.policy.impl.PolicyNotFoundException - If the policy can't be found
        com.guidewire.cc.domain.policy.impl.PolicyNotUniqueException - If the policy is not unique
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the Claim does not already have a Policy

      • isPolicyChanged

        boolean isPolicyChanged()
        Returns true if this claim's policy is edited or replaced. Also returns true if a coverage or endorsement on the policy is added, edited, or deleted. Note that false is returned for changes to all other policy related objects such as vehicles, properties, and contacts.
        Returns:
        True if policy is changed

      • getHistoryRecordsForHistoryType

        IQueryBeanResult<History> getHistoryRecordsForHistoryType(HistoryType eventType)
        Preferred method of getting history for a given claim. This resolves to a search on the database, based on the claim and history type filter. If the history type is null, all events are returned. It's assumed that if the filter selected in the UI is "none" then this method shouldn't even be called.
        Parameters:
        eventType - The history event type
        Returns:
        The query result

      • getHistoryRecordsForHistoryType

        IQueryBeanResult<History> getHistoryRecordsForHistoryType(HistoryType eventType,
                                                          User owner,
                                                          java.util.Date beginDate,
                                                          java.util.Date endDate)
        Preferred method of getting history for a given claim. This resolves to a search on the database, based on the claim and history type filter. If the history type is null, all events are returned. It's assumed that if the filter selected in the UI is "none" then this method shouldn't even be called. This variation allows querying for specific history events within a given date/time range. Passing along null any of the fields omits that query criteria. Omitting either the start or end date parameter omits the entire date interval filter.
        Parameters:
        eventType - type of history event filter
        owner - Owner of history event filter.
        beginDate - start-of-date range interval to narrow filtering
        endDate - end-of-date range to narror filtering
        Returns:
        The query result

      • getClaimContact

        ClaimContact getClaimContact(Contact contact)

        Returns:
        The associated claim contact, or null if none

      • createClaimContact

        ClaimContact createClaimContact(Contact contact)
        Creates a ClaimContact for this Claim and the given Contact.

        If the Contact is linked to the Address Book, then this method does two additional things:

        1. The Claim's related Contact graph will be searched for a matching Contact. If a match is found, that Contact will be used to create the ClaimContact instead.
        2. The Claim's ContactContact graph will be traversed. Any ContactContacts with missing FKs but matching link ID will be "materialized" with the input Contact.

        Note that this method is not suitable for use with a contact that has just been picked from the address book. Use claimparties.ClaimContactUtil.createClaimContact(claim, tempContact) for contacts picked from the address book.

        Parameters:
        contact - The contact
        Returns:
        The claim contact

      • resolveAndSetContactContact

        void resolveAndSetContactContact(ContactContact contactContact,
                                 Contact primaryContact,
                                 Contact relatedContact)
        This function resolves the relatedContact and its relationships before setting the contactContact. In the case that the relatedContact is brought in from AddressBook, we have to prevent duplicated relationships being added to the primaryContact (which we assumed it to be related to the claim). Therefore, any relationships between the two contacts are removed.
        Parameters:
        contactContact - The contact relationship
        primaryContact - The primary contact
        relatedContact - The related contact

        The resolved contact

      • getRelatedContacts

        Contact[] getRelatedContacts()
        Returns the list of Contact objects related to a claim. This includes the insured, main contact, reported by person, the driver (if applicable), and all other people associated with the claim. It also includes people covered by the associated policy. Duplicates are eliminated, and contacts are sorted alphabetically by display name. Used to populate pickers for selecting a person who might be relevant to the claim.
        Returns:
        array of contacts associated with the claim

      • getRelatedContacts

        Contact[] getRelatedContacts(IType subtype)
        Returns the list of Contact objects of a given type that are related to a claim. Used to populate pickers for selecting a person who might be relevant to the claim.
        Parameters:
        subtype - The subtype
        Returns:
        array of contacts associated with the claim. The component type of the array is that of the given subtype. For example, for the subtype representing "Person" the return value will be of type Person[].
        See Also:
        getRelatedContacts()

      • newActivity

        Activity newActivity(ActivityPattern pattern,
                     Exposure exposure)
        Creates an activity from an activity pattern. The type of the created activity will match the type of the pattern. Fields on the activity will be populated by fields on the pattern, including the escalation date, which is calculated from the estimated completion days on the pattern.

        The previousUserID field is also set with the id of the user calling this method. In future, the rules engine and other automated clients of the API will have distinct users - until then, the previousUserID will be null

        Parameters:
        pattern - Pattern with with to populate a new activity
        exposure - Exposure to associate with the activity
        Returns:
        A new activity populated by the pattern

      • createWarningActivity

                               Key groupID,
                               java.lang.String patternName)

        Parameters:
        userID - the user used in assignment.
        groupID - the group used in assignment
        patternName - the activty pattern
        Returns:
        the newly created activity

      • createActivity

        Activity createActivity(Exposure exposure,
                        ActivityPattern pattern,
                        java.lang.String subject,
                        java.lang.String description,
                        Priority priority,
                        java.lang.Boolean mandatory,
                        java.util.Date targetStartDate,
                        java.util.Date escalationStartDate)
        Convenience method; creates an activity using newActivity and the given pattern, plus the following
        • sets the given fields
        • Uses activity pattern to calculate the escalation date and target date. If the start date for the target date or escalation date is null, the respective field in the activity pattern will be used for the calculation
        • calls Activity.setUp(gw.api.assignment.Assignee) to assign it.
        Parameters:
        exposure - exposure to create activity on
        pattern - the activity pattern used to create the activity
        subject - subject field for the activity
        description - description for the activity
        priority - priority field for the activity
        mandatory - mandatory field for the activity
        targetStartDate - If provided, this will be used as start date for the target date calculation
        escalationStartDate - If provided, this will be used as start date for escalation date calculation
        Returns:
        created activity
        See Also:
        newActivity(entity.ActivityPattern, Exposure), Activity.setUp(gw.api.assignment.Assignee)

      • createActivityFromPattern

        The created activity pattern

      • isExposureListChangeable

        boolean isExposureListChangeable()
        Can exposures be added to this claim? Claims with some loss types can have a variable number of exposures, while others always have a fixed set. For example in many systems Workers Compensation claims always have just one or two exposures and the end user cannot add or remove exposures once the claim has been created. This property reads a configuration parameter, ShowNewExposureMenuForLossTypes, and returns true if the loss type of the current claim is in that list. The result of this method is used to enable and disable various features in the UI - for example whether to show the new exposure menu, whether to show the claim exposure list page etc.
        Returns:
        true if this claim's loss type is such that it can have a variable number of exposures, false otherwise

      • isExposureListVisibleInLossDetails

        boolean isExposureListVisibleInLossDetails()
        Should the exposures for this claim be displayed in the loss details area of the UI?
        Returns:
        true if this claim's loss type is such that it has a fixed set of exposures and the configuration parameter ShowFixedExposuresInLossDetails is true

      • isExposureListVisibleInClaimFile

        boolean isExposureListVisibleInClaimFile()
        Should the exposures for this claim be displayed in the top level of the claim file?
        Returns:
        true if this claim's loss type is such that it has a fixed set of exposures and the configuration parameter ShowFixedExposuresInLossDetails is false

      • newExposure

        Exposure newExposure(ExposureType subtype,
                     boolean useClaimSource)
        Returns an editable Exposure in either a new bundle or the bundle of the claim. The exposure is initialized with the following values:
        • Claim - set to this claim
        • ClaimOrder - set to maximum ClaimOrder of the existing exposures on the claim plus one
        • ExposureType - set to the given type
        • State - set to Draft
        • Incident - set to a newly created incident of the appropriate type for this exposure
            Unless this method is used in the new claim wizard you will usually want to call the exposure's saveAndSetup method before committing the new exposure, to set its state to "Open" and to run the appropriate rules. You don't need to do this if this method is called in the new claim wizard as the claim's saveAndSetup method (called at the end of the wizard) will also save and set up the claim's draft exposures.
        Parameters:
        subtype - the exposure "subtype"
        useClaimSource - if true, and if the claim is in a writable bundle, then creates the exposure in the claim's bundle. Otherwise the exposure is created in a new bundle. This parameter should nearly always be true.
        Returns:
        the newly created exposure

      • newExposure

        Exposure newExposure(CoverageType coverageType,
                     CoverageSubtype coverageSubType,
                     boolean useClaimSource)
        Returns an editable Exposure in either a new bundle or the bundle of the claim. The exposure is initialized with the following values:
        • Claim - set to this claim
        • ClaimOrder - set to maximum ClaimOrder of the existing exposures on the claim plus one
        • ExposureType - set to the exposure type determined by coverageSubType
        • PrimaryCoverage - set to the given coverage type
        • CoverageSubType - set to the given coverage subtype
        • LossParty - if there is only one possible loss party type value for the given coverage subtype then the loss party will be set to that value. Otherwise it will be set to null.
        • State - set to Draft
        • Incident - set to a newly created incident of the appropriate type for this exposure
            Unless this method is used in the new claim wizard you will usually want to call the exposure's saveAndSetup method before committing the new exposure, to set its state to "Open" and to run the appropriate rules. You don't need to do this if this method is called in the new claim wizard as the claim's saveAndSetup method (called at the end of the wizard) will also save and set up the claim's draft exposures.
        Parameters:
        coverageType - the exposure coverage type
        coverageSubType - the exposure coverage sub type
        useClaimSource - if true, and if the claim is in a writable bundle, then creates the exposure in the claim's bundle. Otherwise the exposure is created in a new bundle. This parameter should nearly always be true.
        Returns:
        the newly created exposure

      • newExposureWithNoIncident

        Exposure newExposureWithNoIncident(CoverageType coverageType,
                                   CoverageSubtype coverageSubtype,
                                   Coverage coverage)
        Creates a new Exposure in the same bundle as the claim (which must be in an editable bundle). The exposure is initialized with the following values:
        • Claim - set to this claim,
        • ClaimOrder - set to maximum ClaimOrder of the existing exposures on the claim plus one
        • ExposureType - set to the exposure type determined by coverageSubType
        • PrimaryCoverage - set to the given coverage type
        • CoverageSubType - set to the given coverage subtype
        • LossParty - if there is only one possible loss party type value for the given coverage subtype then the loss party will be set to that value. Otherwise it will be set to null.
        • Coverage - set to the given coverage (may be null)
        • State - set to Draft
        The exposure incident is not created and is left null, so the caller can set or create the incident as they wish. For example, they might:
        • Create a new, empty, incident using the exposure's ensureIncidentCreated() method
        • Set the incident field to point at an existing incident from this claim
        • Call a custom method to create the incident and then set the incident field to point at this new incident
        This method gives the most control when creating a new exposure. If you use one of the other newExposure methods to create a new exposure and a new incident at the same time it is tricky to set the incident if you want to create or set it yourself. You will have to explicitly remove the automatically created incident and then replace it with your own. If you just set the incident field without doing a remove the automatically created incident will still be in the bundle and will be added to the claim when it commits. But if you use this method it is trivial to add a new incident if you want to, but you can also set it to an existing or custom value if you wish.

        Unless this method is used in the new claim wizard you will usually want to call the exposure's saveAndSetup method before committing the new exposure, to set its state to "Open" and to run the appropriate rules. You don't need to do this if this method is called in the new claim wizard as the claim's saveAndSetup method (called at the end of the wizard) will also save and set up the claim's draft exposures.

        Parameters:
        coverageType - the exposure coverage type, must not be null
        coverageSubtype - the exposure coverage sub type, must not be null
        coverage - the exposure coverage, can be null
        Returns:
        the newly created exposure, with a null incident

      • hasExposureOfType

        boolean hasExposureOfType(ExposureType exposureType)

        For example, if Joe Smith is a claimant on claim CP-2038, and he is the claimant for two exposures, then this method will return a List containing two Exposure beans--the two Exposures for which he is the claimant.

      • isDuplicateClaimNumber

        boolean isDuplicateClaimNumber()
        Queries the database to see if any other claim has the same claim number as this one. Useful in the new claim wizard, if claim number generation is disabled. If this claim's number is blank (null, empty or all whitespace) doesn't even query database and just returns false, on the assumption that no claim can have a blank claim number.
        Returns:
        true if there is an existing claim with the same claim number, false otherwise.

      • saveAndSetup

        void saveAndSetup(Assignee claimAssignment,
                  Assignee[] exposureAssignments)
           throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.ConcurrentDataChangeException,
                  com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.IllegalAssignmentException,
                  com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException,
                  com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.NoAssignmentFoundException,
                  com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClaimNumberNotUniqueException,
                  com.guidewire.cc.domain.claim.ClaimNumberException
        Saves and sets up the claim.
        Parameters:
        claimAssignment - The claim assignment
        exposureAssignments - the assignment options describing how to assign each exposure on the claim. This parameter can be null, in which case the exposures are auto assigned. If it is not null the assignment options are matched to exposures by calling Claim.getOrderedExposures(). Each entry of exposureAssignments is applied to the corresponding exposure. If the lengths of the arrays do not match, or if any of the assignment options is null, an exception is thrown
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.ConcurrentDataChangeException - Thrown if the claim or a part of the claim file that is being changed has been changed by another user
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.IllegalAssignmentException - If the assigned user does not have required permissions
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - User has insufficient permissions to save the claim
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.NoAssignmentFoundException - No assignment could be found based on requested assignment target
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If exposureAssignments is non null and either has the wrong number of elements or contains a null element.
        com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClaimNumberNotUniqueException - If the generated claim number is not unique
        com.guidewire.cc.domain.claim.ClaimNumberException - If an error occurred creating a claim number

      • getAddresses

        Address[] getAddresses()
        Returns a List of Address objects (e.g., postal addresses) that are related to the Claim. This is used, for example, to find possible candidates for Claim loss location. This currently includes:
        • The addresses of any properties listed on the policy
        • All of the insured's addresses.
        • All of the policyholder's addresses.
        • All of the DBA's addresses.
        • The claim's loss location.
        Returns:
        a List of Address objects related to the claim.

      • canEditAddress

        boolean canEditAddress(Address address)
        Can the given address be edited? The address argument should be one of the addresses returned by getAddresses(). Returns false if the address belongs to a property or contact on the policy and the policy is verified, otherwise returns true. Returns false if address is null
        Parameters:
        address - The address to check
        Returns:
        True if can edit this address

      • scheduleGeocoding

        void scheduleGeocoding(Address address)
        If a geocoding plugin is configured, adds a work item to geocode the specified address in batch mode
        Parameters:
        address -

      • setFlag

        void setFlag(java.lang.String flaggedReason)
        Adds a problem description to the claim
        Parameters:
        flaggedReason - The reason for the flag

      • removeFlagReason

        boolean removeFlagReason(java.lang.String flaggedReason)
        Removes a problem description from the claim
        Parameters:
        flaggedReason - Reason to be removed
        Returns:
        True if claim was actually flagged

      • clearFlag

        void clearFlag(java.lang.String noteString)
        Clears the flag from a claim
        Parameters:
        noteString - A note to add while clearing the flag.

      • validate

        ValidationResult validate(boolean validateExposures)
        Executes new claim validation rules on the supplied claim, and returns a validation object containing any errors (if validation was successful, an empty validation object is returned). Note that this method has the side-effect of setting the validation level, and hence requires that the current user have Claim EDIT permissions, or will throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        validateExposures - If true, validates the claim and all the claim's exposures. Otherwise, validates the claim only.
        Returns:
        The validation result
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - If the current user does not have Claim EDIT permissions

      • newRITransactionSet

        RITransactionSet newRITransactionSet()
        Adds a new RITransactionSet with no RITransactions to this claim.
        Returns:
        The transaction set

      • getNumTransactions

        int getNumTransactions()
        Retrieves the number of financial transactions, of all subtypes, associated with this claim regardless of status. This method should always be preferred over getTransactions().length, as it does not actually retrieve the transactions in full in order to count them.
        Returns:
        the number of financial transactions associated with this claim as an int.

      • getAggregateLimits

        AggregateLimit[] getAggregateLimits()
        Returns the AggregateLimits of all PolicyPeriods associated with the policy of this claim.
        Returns:
        The aggregate limits

      • isWithinEffectivePeriod

        boolean isWithinEffectivePeriod(AggregateLimitType limitType)
        If the given limit type is AggregateLimitType.TC_ANNUALREPORTEDDATE, then returns true if this claim's reported date is within or on its policy's effective and expiration date.

        If the given limit type is AggregateLimitType.TC_ANNUALLOSSDATE, then returns true if this claim's loss date is within or on its policy's effective and expiration date.

        If the given limit type is AggregateLimitType.TC_LIFETIMELIMIT, then returns true.

        Parameters:
        limitType - The aggregate limit type
        Returns:
        True or false based on the aggregate limit type (see above)

      • canClose

        boolean canClose(User user)
        Returns true if this claim is in the open state and the specified user is allowed to close it.
        Parameters:
        user - the User whose permissions should be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the claim can be closed by this user.

      • canRemoveFlag

        boolean canRemoveFlag(User user)
        Returns true if the claim is flagged AND the user is allowed to clear the flag.
        Parameters:
        user - the User whose permissions should be checked.
        Returns:
        true iff the claim is flagged AND the user is allowed to clear the flag.

      • canReopen

        Returns true if the claim is in the closed state and the user is allowed to reopen it.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true iff the claim is closed AND the user is allowed to reopen the claim.

      • cancelClaim

        void cancelClaim()
          throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.ActiveMessageException,
                 com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.PurgeBlockedException,
                 com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClaimOpenException,
                 EntityStateException
        Cancel the creation of this claim that has been saved as Draft -- marks the claim and its exposures for purge.
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClaimOpenException - if the indicated claim is not draft state (note might be closed, not open, but the point is you can't cancel it).
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.PurgeBlockedException - if another object in the database references this Claim.
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.ActiveMessageException - if there is an active integration message for this claim.
        EntityStateException - If the claim is not in a cancellable state

      • isNewForUser

        boolean isNewForUser(User user)
        Indicates whether or not this is considered a new claim with reference to this user. A claim is considered "new" for a user if the claim has a temporary ID or if the claim is in draft state and this user is the user that created the claim.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to check
        Returns:
        true if this is a new claim for this user, false otherwise

      • hasClaimantOnClaim

        boolean hasClaimantOnClaim()
        Deprecated. use canHaveClaimantOnClaim() instead
        Returns:
        True if there is a claimant on the claim

      • canHaveClaimantOnClaim

        boolean canHaveClaimantOnClaim()
        Determines if claim can have a claimant at the claim level by checking that the Claimant role is NOT prohibited for this loss typel.
        Returns:
        true if this claim can have a claimant at the claim level

      • isClaimLevelPaymentAllowed

        boolean isClaimLevelPaymentAllowed()
        Returns true if a payment can be made against this claim at the claim-level. Specifically, returns true if:
        • Claim is closed and previous payments have been made on it
        • Claim is open and global PaymentExceedsReserves = true
        • Claim is open and no reserves have been created for the claim
        • Claim is open and has available reserves
        Returns:
        True if claim level payment is allowed

      • getChecks

        @Deprecated
Check[] getChecks()
        Deprecated. Users should use getChecksIterator(boolean) in a rules context, or ClaimFinancialsTransactionsUtil.getChecksQuery(Claim) if populating a list view separate from the Checks list view provided in the base application configuration.

        Gets all the Check entities for the given Claim. The system calculates this set by looking up the Check for every Payment on the Claim. When you are in a read-only context (i.e., none of the claim's checks are new/updated/removed and not yet committed to the database) use getChecksQuery() in rules instead. getChecksQuery returns a QueryProcessor from which you can get an Iterator. This is a far more efficient way to get all the checks for a claim.

        Note: The beans returned by getChecks() are not guaranteed to be in the same bundle as this Claim, and their bundle may not be editable. To edit the beans, you should add them to an editable bundle first.

        Returns:
        All the checks associated with this claim

      • getChecksQuery

        IQueryBeanResult<Check> getChecksQuery()
        Constructs a query to retrieve all the Checks for this claim. This is a much more efficient way to get the checks for this claim than using getChecks() when you are in a read-only context (i.e., none of the claim's checks are new/updated/removed and not yet commited to the database)
        Returns:
        a QueryProcessor enscapulating the checks query

      • getChecksIterator

        java.util.Iterator<Check> getChecksIterator(boolean newAndModifiedOnly)
        Constructs an Iterator to provide access to the Checks for this claim. Either all the Checks or only the new and modified Checks can be chosen for retrieval. If all the Checks are chosen for retrieval, then those Checks that have been removed in the current transaction will not be returned by the Iterator.

        Note: This is a more efficient alternative to calling getChecks(), particularly if you are only interested in new or modified Checks Note: When newAndModifiedOnly is false, the beans returned by this iterator are not guaranteed to be in the same bundle as this Claim, and their bundle may not be editable. To edit the beans, you should add them to an editable bundle first.

        Parameters:
        newAndModifiedOnly - if true then only new and modified Checks for this claim will be returned. This includes checks for which an associated payment or lineitem has been modified. Otherwise, if false then all Checks for the claim will be returned, including new and modified Checks, but excluding deleted Checks.
        Returns:
        an Iterator that returns Checks

      • getTransactionsIterator

        java.util.Iterator<Transaction> getTransactionsIterator(boolean newAndModifiedOnly)
        Constructs an Iterator to provide access to the Transactions for this claim. Either all the Transactions or only the new and modified Transactions can be chosen for retrieval. If all the Transactions are chosen for retrieval, then those Transactions that have been removed in the current transaction will not be returned by the Iterator.

        Note: This is a more efficient alternative to calling Claim.getTransactions(), particularly if you are only interested in new or modified transactions Note: When newAndModifiedOnly is false, the beans returned by this iterator are not guaranteed to be in the same bundle as this Claim, and their bundle may not be editable. To edit the beans, you should add them to an editable bundle first.

        Parameters:
        newAndModifiedOnly - if true then only new and modified Transactions for this claim will be returned. This includes transactions for which only the line items have been modified. Otherwise, if false then all Transactions for the claim will be returned, including new and modified Transactions, but excluding deleted Transactions.
        Returns:
        an Iterator that returns Transactions

      • getTransactionsQuery

        IQueryBeanResult<TransactionDefaultView> getTransactionsQuery()
        Constructs a query to use for retrieving all the transactions, regardless of subtype, for this claim. this query is suitable for populating a ListView in the ClaimCenter UI. The query also filters by the current user's transaction view permissions. The transactions will be returned as they currently exist on the database.
        Returns:
        a QueryProcessor that encapsulates the query to return all Transactions for this claim. The returned rows are actually TransactionDefaultView entities for efficiency.

      • getPaymentsIterator

        java.util.Iterator<Payment> getPaymentsIterator(boolean newAndModifiedOnly)
        Constructs an Iterator to provide access to the Payments for this claim. Either all the Payments or only the new and modified Payments can be chosen for retrieval. If all the Payments are chosen for retrieval, then those Payments that have been removed in the current transaction will not be returned by the Iterator.

        Note: This is a much more efficient alternative to calling Claim.getTransactions() and iterating through all the transactions to find just the desired Payments. Note: When newAndModifiedOnly is false, the beans returned by this iterator are not guaranteed to be in the same bundle as this Claim, and their bundle may not be editable. To edit the beans, you should add them to an editable bundle first.

        Parameters:
        newAndModifiedOnly - if true then only new and modified Payments for this claim will be returned. This includes payments for which only the line items have been modified. Otherwise, if false then all Payments for the claim will be returned, including new and modified Payments, but excluding deleted Payments.
        Returns:
        an Iterator that returns Payments

      • getPaymentsQuery

        IQueryBeanResult<PaymentView> getPaymentsQuery()
        Constructs a query to use for retrieving all the payments for this claim. this query is suitable for populating a ListView in the ClaimCenter UI. The query also filters by the current user's transaction view permissions, so the results may be empty if the user has no payment view permission. The payments will be returned as they currently exist on the database.
        Returns:
        a QueryProcessor that encapsulates the query to return all Payments for this claim. The returned rows are actually PaymentView entities for efficiency.

        Note: This is a much more efficient alternative to calling Claim.getTransactions() and iterating through all the transactions to find just the desired Reserves. Note: When newAndModifiedOnly is false, the beans returned by this iterator are not guaranteed to be in the same bundle as this Claim, and their bundle may not be editable. To edit the beans, you should add them to an editable bundle first.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • createCheck

        Check createCheck(Contact payee,
                  ContactRole payeeRole,
                  Contact recipient,
                  Address mailingAddress,
                  ReportabilityType reportabilityType,
                  CostType costType,
                  CostCategory costCategory,
                  PaymentType paymentType,
                  LineCategory lineCategory,
                  java.math.BigDecimal checkAmount,
                  java.lang.String comments,
                  java.lang.String memo,
                  java.lang.String payTo,
                  java.util.Date scheduledSendDate,
                  User requestingUser)
           throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException,
                  com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.WorkflowValidationException,
                  com.guidewire.cc.domain.financials.adapter.exception.DeductionAdapterException
        Deprecated. Use CheckCreator instead to get a CheckCreator for the Claim and then create the check
        Creates a claim-level check on this claim with the given parameters. The check will contain one payment with one line item. To create a check with a payment that is coded to a particular exposure rather than being claim-level, the proper method to use is one of the versions of entity.Exposure#createCheck
        Parameters:
        payee - The payee of the check.
        payeeRole - The role of the check payee (Insured, Claimant, Vendor, Other)
        recipient - The contact the check should be sent to
        mailingAddress - The address the check should be sent to
        reportabilityType - The reportability type of the check
        costType - The costtype for the payment - cannot be null, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        costCategory - The costcategory for the payment - cannot be null, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        paymentType - The paymenttype for this payment - can be null, in which case the payment type will default to 'Partial'
        lineCategory - The category for the payment line item
        checkAmount - The amount of the payment line item (and therefore the check)
        comments - Comments on this check
        memo - The memo for the check
        payTo - The pay to for the check
        scheduledSendDate - The scheduled send date of the check
        requestingUser - The user requesting this check @return the created check
        Returns:
        The created check
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException - if the submitting user does not have authority to create the check
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.WorkflowValidationException - if there is a problem during workflow validation
        com.guidewire.cc.domain.financials.adapter.exception.DeductionAdapterException - if a configured DeductionAdapter is unavailable or experiences some other error while trying to get the deductions.

      • createCheck

        Check createCheck(Contact payee,
                  ContactRole payeeRole,
                  Contact recipient,
                  Address mailingAddress,
                  ReportabilityType reportabilityType,
                  CostType costType,
                  CostCategory costCategory,
                  PaymentType paymentType,
                  LineCategory lineCategory,
                  java.math.BigDecimal checkAmount,
                  Currency checkCurrency,
                  java.math.BigDecimal transToClaimExchangeRateOverride,
                  java.lang.String customExchangeRateDescription,
                  java.math.BigDecimal claimAmountOverride,
                  java.math.BigDecimal reportingAmountOverride,
                  java.lang.String comments,
                  java.lang.String memo,
                  java.lang.String payTo,
                  java.util.Date scheduledSendDate,
                  User requestingUser)
           throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException,
                  com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.WorkflowValidationException,
                  com.guidewire.cc.domain.financials.adapter.exception.DeductionAdapterException
        Deprecated. Use CheckCreator instead to get a CheckCreator for the Claim and then create the check
        Creates a claim-level check on this claim with the given parameters. The check will contain one payment with one line item. To create a check with a payment that is coded to a particular exposure rather than being claim-level, the proper method to use is one of the versions of Exposure#createCheck
        Parameters:
        payee - The payee of the check.
        payeeRole - The role of the check payee (Insured, Claimant, Vendor, Other)
        recipient - The contact the check should be sent to
        mailingAddress - The address the check should be sent to
        reportabilityType - The reportability type of the check
        costType - The costtype for the payment - cannot be null, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        costCategory - The costcategory for the payment - cannot be null, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        paymentType - The paymenttype for this payment - can be null, in which case the payment type will default to 'Partial'
        lineCategory - The category for the payment line item
        checkAmount - The amount of the payment line item (and therefore the check)
        checkCurrency - The currency of the check. null value uses claim currency.
        transToClaimExchangeRateOverride - Use null for the current market rate. A positive non-null value sets Check.OverrideExchangeRate to true and sets this value as the TransToClaim exchange rate.
        customExchangeRateDescription - Use null if transToClaimExchangeRateOverride is null. Otherwise, describes the overriden exchange rate.
        claimAmountOverride - Please use null. A non-null value overrides the ClaimAmount calculated from the checkAmount and exchange rate.
        reportingAmountOverride - The reporting Amount to override, not used for now, MUST BE NULL
        comments - Comments on this check
        memo - The memo for the check
        payTo - The pay to for the check
        scheduledSendDate - The scheduled send date of the check
        requestingUser - The user requesting this check @return the created check
        Returns:
        the new check
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException - if the submitting user does not have authority to create the check
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.WorkflowValidationException - if there is a problem during workflow validation
        com.guidewire.cc.domain.financials.adapter.exception.DeductionAdapterException - if a configured DeductionAdapter is unavailable or experiences some other error while trying to get the deductions.

      • createRecovery

        Recovery createRecovery(Contact payer,
                        CostType costType,
                        CostCategory costCategory,
                        RecoveryCategory recoveryCategory,
                        LineCategory lineCategory,
                        java.math.BigDecimal recoveryAmount,
                        java.lang.String comments,
                        User requestingUser)
        Creates a claim-level recovery. The recovery is created with one line item and the Claim Currency.
        Parameters:
        payer - The payer of the recovery.
        costType - The costtype for the recovery. This value cannot be null.
        costCategory - The costcategory for the recovery This value cannot be null.
        recoveryCategory - The Recovery Category for the recovery.
        lineCategory - The category for the line item. (We assume only one line item -- this is nullable.)
        recoveryAmount - The amount of the recovery line item (and therefore the recovery). The amount must be positive.
        comments - Comments on this recovery.
        requestingUser - The user requesting this recovery.
        Returns:
        the created recovery

      • createRecovery

        Recovery createRecovery(Contact payer,
                        CostType costType,
                        CostCategory costCategory,
                        RecoveryCategory recoveryCategory,
                        LineCategory lineCategory,
                        java.math.BigDecimal recoveryAmount,
                        Currency recoveryCurrency,
                        java.math.BigDecimal exchangeRateOverride,
                        java.lang.String customExchangeRateDescription,
                        java.math.BigDecimal claimAmountOverride,
                        java.math.BigDecimal reportingAmountOverride,
                        java.lang.String comments,
                        User requestingUser)
        Creates a claim-level recovery. The recovery is created with one line item.
        Parameters:
        payer - The payer of the recovery.
        costType - The costtype for the recovery. This value cannot be null.
        costCategory - The costcategory for the recovery This value cannot be null.
        recoveryCategory - The Recovery Category for the recovery.
        lineCategory - The category for the line item. (We assume only one line item -- this is nullable.)
        recoveryAmount - The amount of the recovery line item (and therefore the recovery). The amount must be positive.
        recoveryCurrency - The currency of the recoveryAmount.
        exchangeRateOverride - The exchange rate that is to be used to override the default rate, can be null
        customExchangeRateDescription - The custom exchange rate description, can be null
        claimAmountOverride - The claim amount to override the automatically calculated amount, can be null
        reportingAmountOverride - The reporting Amount to override, not used for now, MUST BE NULL
        comments - Comments on this recovery.
        requestingUser - The user requesting this recovery.
        Returns:
        the created recovery

        Note addNote(Exposure exposure,

        Adds a note to a claim and optional exposure.
        Parameters:
        exposure - A related exposure. Optional - may be null.
        topic - The topic type.
        strBody - The body text of the note.
        Returns:
        The new note

             NoteTopicType topic,

      • hasWorkedOn

        boolean hasWorkedOn(Key groupId)
        Determines whether anyone in the specified group has worked on this claim before.

        "Worked on a claim" includes the (current) claim owner, owner of a exposure, owner of an activity (open or closed) related to the claim, and owner of an activity (open or closed) related to a exposure.

        Parameters:
        groupId - The id of a group to check on.
        Returns:
        true if any member of the group has worked on this claim

      • isValid

        boolean isValid(ValidationLevel level,
                boolean bIncludeExposures)
        Returns true if this claim is valid at the specified level. Optionally checks exposures too. Note this method does not call validation rules; it simply check the claim's existing validation level.
        Parameters:
        level - The level to check against.
        bIncludeExposures - Indicates whether or not the claim's exposures s/b checked as well.
        Returns:
        True if this claim is valid at the specified level.

      • createPolicyRenewalAlert

        void createPolicyRenewalAlert(java.lang.String severityCode,
                              java.lang.String description)
        Deprecated. use messaging and a custom web service instead of this interface
        Generates a new policy renewal alert in the policy system, via a call to the IPolicyRenewalAlertAdapter plugin

        This method was added in early versions of ClaimCenter when much less could be done directly in Gosu. The combination of this method and the IPolicyRenewalAlertAdapter plugin gave a way for customers to call a remote policy system from rules. In the out of box product the actual implementation of the plugin is empty and no code calls createPolicyRenewalAlert, so it is essentially a hook which provides no intrinsic functionality but can be used as an extension point. In more recent versions of ClaimCenter customers can create arbitrary custom web services and call them from Gosu so there is no point in maintaining this interface as a separate extension point - the interface is limiting and using a direct plugin call, rather than messaging, makes it difficult to implement reliably.

        Parameters:
        severityCode - Severity code of the renewal alert
        description - Description for the alert

      • verifyAbilityToPay

        void verifyAbilityToPay(boolean verifyExposures)
                 throws EntityValidationException,
                        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException
        Validates this claim and, if the verifyExposures flag is true, then each of its exposures. Throws NewCheckAbilityToPayFailedException if the ValidationLevel.TC_PAYMENT validation level is not reached for the claim.
        Parameters:
        verifyExposures - if true then all the claim's exposure are also verified, though no EntityValidationException will be thrown even if one of the exposures fails validation.
        Throws:
        EntityValidationException - if the claim does not pass the payment validation level.
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientPermissionException - if all exposures throw such an exception

      • hasAwaitingSubmissionPaymentsForToday

        boolean hasAwaitingSubmissionPaymentsForToday()
        Tests whether this claim has at least one claim-level payment whose status is Awaiting Submission and whose scheduled send date is today.
        Returns:
        true if the above criteria are met, else false

      • hasPassedAbilityToPay

        boolean hasPassedAbilityToPay()
        Verifies whether this claim has passed the ability to pay validation level and so can have a payment created against it. The verification may potentially end up performing validation of the claim.
        Returns:
        true if this claim has passed the "ability to pay" validation level, else false

      • isAtAbilityToPay

        boolean isAtAbilityToPay()
        Verifies whether this claim is at the ability to pay validation level. Note: Unlike hasPassedAbilityToPay(), this API never performs validation of the claim. It only verifies against whatever validation level that has been set currently on the claim.
        Returns:
        true if this claim is at the "ability to pay" validation level, else false

      • getIncidentsOfType

        Incident[] getIncidentsOfType(IEntityType type)
        Get all incidents of the given type on this claim
        Parameters:
        type - incident type, must not be null and must be incident or a subtype of incident
        Returns:
        incidents on this claim which are instances of the given type, or an empty array if there are no such incidents. Only incidents of this exact type are returned, not any incidents which are subtypes of type. The type of the returned array is type[] - for example if type is VehicleIncident the array will be a VehicleIncident array, not just an Incident array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is null or not an incident type

      • getClaimInjuryIncident

        InjuryIncident getClaimInjuryIncident()
        The InjuryIncident that holds values of injury-related fields formerly on Claim. Only used out-of-the-box for WorkersComp. This property should only be used in a read context. See Claim.ensureClaimInjuryIncident().

        Note that the ClaimInjuryIncident, if it exists, will be present in the Claim.Incidents array, but it is filtered out of Claim.InjuryIncidentsOnly and Claim.RoleOwners. This is why Claim.InjuryIncidentsOnly and similar properties are preferred to using Claim.Incidents.

        Returns:
        first and only InjuryIncident on this Claim where InjuryIncident.ClaimIncident == true.

      • ensureClaimInjuryIncident

        InjuryIncident ensureClaimInjuryIncident()
        Return ClaimInjuryIncident, creating one if it does not yet exist. This should be used in PCFs or wherever the ClaimInjuryIncident fields may be edited, in case the CII does not yet exist. See also Claim.ClaimInjuryIncident property.
        Returns:
        The claim injury incident

      • reportArchiveProblem

        void reportArchiveProblem(java.lang.String reason)
        Used by rules to report archiving problems. If a problem is reported the Claim will be excluded from archive, meaning it will not be picked up again by the archiving process. To skip this Claim temporarily, use skipFromArchiving().
        Parameters:
        reason - reason that this claim cannot be archived

      • skipFromArchiving

        void skipFromArchiving(java.lang.String reason)
        Skip archival of this claim. Usually called by a rule when it has determined that the claim is not ready to be archived yet. Unlike reportArchiveProblem(), this method returns immediately and no more rules are processed.
        Parameters:
        reason - The reason for skipping.

        Returns:

      • getAllowedPayeeTypes

        ContactRole[] getAllowedPayeeTypes(Contact payee)
        Returns a set of valid Payee Types as ContactRoles for the input "payee" parameter Since not all roles for this "payee" parameter on the Claim are valid for a payee of a payment, this method returns the set of allowed roles for this "payee" parameter as a payee of a payment.
        Parameters:
        payee - the payee to be checked for allowed roles
        Returns:
        an array of ContactRoles for the parameter "payee" that are allowed types of a payee on a payment

      • setAvailableReserves

        Reserve setAvailableReserves(CostType costType,
                             CostCategory costCategory,
                             java.math.BigDecimal newReserveAmount,
                             User submittingUser)
                      throws com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedClaimException,
                             com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedExposureException,
                             com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException
        Sets the available reserves for this reserve line to the given amount by creating a reserve that increases or decreases the currently available reserves. This method creates a new ReserveSet and Reserve transaction with the amount necessary to get the AvailableReserves for the matching ReserveLine to equal the newReserveAmount. This transaction amount might be positive if an increase is needed or negative if a decrease is needed. The ReserveSet is not run through pre-setup rules and is immediately submitted for approval. Unlike setting reserves in the UI, this method ignores any Reserve transactions on the same ReserveLine with a status of Pending Approval (since the AvailableReserves calculation does not include PendingApproval reserves). If the current AvailableReserves amount is already equal to newReserveAmount, then this method does not create a new Reserve nor ReserveSet, and returns null.
        Parameters:
        costType - The cost type for the reserve. This value cannot be null.
        costCategory - The cost category for the reserve. This value cannot be null.
        newReserveAmount - The amount the open reserves should be. The amount must be non-null and zero or greater, not negative.
        submittingUser - User submitting this reserve.
        Returns:
        the new reserve (Note: the amount of the returned reserve should not be changed). The method will return null if new reserve is not created.
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedClaimException - if the claim is closed (reserves cannot be created on closed claims)
        com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedExposureException - if the exposure is closed (reserves cannot be created on closed exposures)
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException - if the submitting user does not have authority to create the reserve

      • setOpenRecoveryReserves

        RecoveryReserve setOpenRecoveryReserves(CostType costType,
                                        CostCategory costCategory,
                                        RecoveryCategory recoveryCategory,
                                        java.math.BigDecimal newRecoveryReserveAmount,
                                        User submittingUser)
                                 throws com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedClaimException,
                                        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException,
                                        com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.RecoveryReservesNotAllowedException
        Sets the open recovery reserves for this claim to the given amount by creating a recovery reserve that increases or decreases the current open recovery reserves.
        Parameters:
        costType - The cost type for the recovery reserve. This value cannot be null.
        costCategory - The cost category for the recovery reserve. This value cannot be null.
        recoveryCategory - The recovery category for the recovery reserve. This value cannot be null.
        newRecoveryReserveAmount - The amount the open recovery reserves should be. The amount must be non-null and zero or greater, not negative.
        submittingUser - User submitting this recovery reserve.
        Returns:
        the new reserve (Note: the amount of the returned reserve should not be changed). The method will return null if new reserve is not created.
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedClaimException - if the claim is closed (recovery reserves cannot be created on closed claims).
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException - if the submitting user does not have authority to create the recovery reserve.
        com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.RecoveryReservesNotAllowedException - if the recovery reserve has an illegal status

      • generateTempClaimNumber

        void generateTempClaimNumber()
        Assign a claim number for a draft claim by calling the claim number adapater. The server will verify that the number is unique and re-query the adapter if it isn't. This method is called when the claim is first created but doesn't have complete data yet. The method generateNewClaimNumber(Claim) will be called for a permanent claim number when the claim's data is complete (and it is about to be opened).

      • scheduleHealthUpdate

        void scheduleHealthUpdate()
        Ensure that the claim's metrics and indicators will be updated when the claim's bundle is committed. This method does not calculate any metric or indicator values immediately, it just arranges that they will be calculated during bundle commit. The calculations must only be done once per commit and they should happen fairly late in the commit process - for example the pre update rules and entity callbacks should already have been executed when the metrics and indicators are calculated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the claim is not in a writeable bundle

      • forceRecalculateMetrics

        void forceRecalculateMetrics()
        Forces the claim to add any missing claim indicators, claim metrics or exposure metrics. This will usually occur when a new indicator or metric has been added to a pre-existing claim. This should only ever be called within a batch process or exception rule.

      • freezeCurrency

        void freezeCurrency()
        Adds the claim's currency value to BundleCommitCondition, if the currency gets changed, current bundle will not be able to commit. If the currency is already freezed, it will not be refreezed with the current value.

      • freezeState

        void freezeState()
        Adds the claim's state value to BundleCommitCondition, if the state gets changed, current bundle will not be able to commit. If the state is already frozen, it will not be refrozen with the current value.

        Returns:
        boolean true if any active Messages exist

      • createDummyReserveLine

        ReserveLine createDummyReserveLine(Currency reservingCurrency)
        Creates a new reserve line on this claim with the given reserving currency. The new reserve line's exposure, cost type, and cost category are left null, meaning the new reserve line is primarily useful as a placeholder in the UI. If the given reserving currency is null, it defaults to this claim's currency.

        Returns:

      • getRelatedUserGroupMap

        java.util.Map<User,Group> getRelatedUserGroupMap(User excludedUser)
        Returns a map of users and groups related to the claim: all users that are assigned to either the claim, its exposures, or any of its activities. Returns an empty hashmap if the claim is new, since new claims and their activities/exposures haven't been assigned yet.

        The specified User is excluded from the set of returned User objects.

        Parameters:
        excludedUser - The user to exclude.
        Returns:
        a HashMap that maps assigned user to assigned group; for example, if the entry is for the exposure assigned user, the assigned user will map to the assigned group for that exposure.

      • getRelatedUsers

        User[] getRelatedUsers()
        Returns the list of users related to the claim: all users that are assigned to either the claim, its exposures, or any of its activities. Returns an empty array if the claim is new, since new claims and their activities/exposures haven't been assigned yet.

      • getRelatedUserContacts

        Contact[] getRelatedUserContacts()
        Returns the list of contact objects for the users related to the claim: all users that are assigned to either the claim, its exposures, or any of its activities. Returns an empty array if the claim is new, since new claims and their activities/exposures haven't been assigned yet.

      • setPolicy

        void setPolicy(Policy value)
        Sets the policy for this claim. This method:
        1. Makes sure the policy type is applicable for this claim
        2. Makes sure we can edit this claim
        3. Copies the policy and everything in the policy's bundle into our bundle
        4. Adds a set policy history event
        5. Sets the policy ptr for this claim
        6. Evicts from the bundle any entities not rooted at the claim
        NOTE: If there are objects in the claim (such as exposures) which refer to objects (such as vehicles) which are not present in the new policy, references to the missing objects will be set to null.
        Parameters:
        value - the policy to set
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.cc.domain.policy.exception.InvalidPolicyType - if the policy type is not applicable to this claim
        com.guidewire.cc.domain.policy.exception.CannotChangeCurrencyException - if policy's currency is different from this claim's currency and isCurrencyEditable() returns false

      • setLitigationStatus

        void setLitigationStatus(LitigationStatus value)
        Sets the value of the LitigationStatus field.

      • getNotes

        Note[] getNotes()
        Gets the value of the Notes field. The notes particular to this claim. Notes can also be associated with a particular exposure.
